data.title: Lane College
data.meta_description: Lane College, located in Jackson, Tennessee on approximately 55 acres, is a small, private, co-educational, church-related institution that provides a liberal arts curriculum leading to baccalaureate degrees in the Arts and Sciences.
data.text:
Financial barriers should not hinder you from receiving a quality education. At Lane College, we offer a variety of opportunities to help you financially while also helping you develop the necessary skills for your future. We have a proven track record of producing business leaders, educators, scientists, doctors and lawyers. With these scholarship opportunities and our world-class faculty, Lane College is the perfect place for you to start your story.

International Scholars Pathways to Success is offered to international high school seniors who earn a grade point average of 3.0 or higher. The three pillars in this program are designed to enhance each participant’s academic achievement, social/cultural awareness, and financial future. Those chosen for this program will receive up to $9,700 annually, which is designed to meet the direct cost of attendance. To apply for admission, visit lanecollege.edu and click “FREE TO APPLY” on the homepage. To apply for the scholarship, visit lanecollege.edu and click the Financial Aid and Tuition tab.

Junior College Transfer Scholarship is a one-time award of $1,000 for students who transfer directly to Lane College from an accredited community college or junior college with an associate degree. To receive this one-time award, please submit your final college transcript to the Office of Admissions.

The Lane College Dragons Athletic Program has a rich history and tradition of competing at the NCAA Division-II level as a member of the Southern Intercollegiate Athletic Association (SIAC). The Dragons compete in the following:

Women's Sports Men's Sports Volleyball Football Cross Country Cross Country Basketball Basketball Softball Baseball Tennis Tennis Track and Field Track and Field

For more information on varsity scholarships and to submit a video, please contact dburoughs@lanecollege.edu.

The Lane College Cheerleading Program is a national award winning program dedicated to carrying on the traditions of Lane College by representing the college with pride. Interested persons should have experience in cheer, stunting, and tumbling. For more information and to submit video, please contact qgiles@lanecollege.edu.

The Lane College Dragons Marching Band consists of a group of highly motivated and talented instrumental musicians, a dance team, and color guard that performs during halftime at football games, in the homecoming parade, NBA games, band competitions, and other community events. For more information and to schedule an audition, please contact Christopher Jefferson cjefferson@lanecollege.edu.

The Lane College Concert Choir has performed and recorded across the country. This talented group has performed in front of United States Presidents and celebrities. Historically, the Concert Choir has been led by distinguished directors and composers committed to developing artist, performers and composers. For more information and to schedule an audition, please contact arainbow@lanecollege.edu.

The Lane College Endowed Scholarship Program is funded through donations from a variety of stakeholders. Lane College has over 80 endowed scholarships. The qualification for these scholarships range from 2.0 to 4.0 grade point average; specific majors; community service and leadership achievements; and financial need. For more information on how to apply, please contact lpeoples@lanecollege.edu.

Lane College Scholarships are last dollar designed to help you meet the direct cost of attendance (tuition, fees, books, room and board). The College allows scholarship recipients to stack up to $9,000 in Lane College scholarships.

Lane College International Admissions Policy

Lane College admits students with nonimmigrant status who present official credentials with academic achievement, meet the admission requirements to the college, and have command of written and spoken English. Students must complete the following:

1. Official School(s) Transcript(s) must be evaluated by an agency that is a member of the NACES (National Association of Credential Evaluation Services). Lane College will only be able to admit an applicant after receiving the necessary report from the evaluation company.

2. If your native language is not English, you must demonstrate English proficiency unless you are a US citizen or a permanent resident.

3. Letter of Financial Sponsorship

4. Personal Aspirational Essay

5. Use your name as it appears on your passport and include a valid e-mail address in your application for future communication from Lane College.

Once we have a completed file, the Admissions Committee will review the file and make a decision regarding acceptance. Please note that students will be required to cover fees of one year of tuition before issuing a Form I-20.

We will then submit official hard copies of forms to Melinda Richardson (International Student Liaison)
